title: Golden Gate National Recreation Area: Events
body: Historic and Contemporary Events Image Gallery        Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger responds to the 2007 Cosco Busan oil spill at press conference at Fort Mason NPS/Craig Glassner       Albums in this gallery showcase images from a vast range of events on lands now part of the Golden Gate National Recreation Area including the 2007 Cosco Busan Oil Spill, the 1915 Panama-Pacific International Exhibition, 1906 Earthquake, notable visitors, and troop activity relating to the Spanish-American War, World War I, World War II, and more.   Images within these albums may be used for any legitimate non-commercial public or press use with proper credit given to the National Park Service. If you have any questions or additional information on the historic images, please contact the Park Archives and Records Center’s reference archivist at 415-561-2807 or e-mail us. For information regarding the comtemporary images please contact the Public Affairs Office.                   Events - 1906 Earthquake   46 Photos  The 1906 earthquake and subsequent fire devistated much of San Francisco. Displaced survivors were placed in temporary camps on the Presidio and Fort Mason.          Events - Notable Visitors   21 Photos  Notable visitors to areas within the Golden Gate National Recreation Area.          Events - Spanish-American War   26 Photos  Images relating to troop activity in the Spanish-American War.            Events - World War I   8 Photos  Images relating to troop activity in World War I.          Events - PPIE   11 Photos  Panama-Pacific International Exposition in San Francisco, California, 1915.          Events - World War II   82 Photos  Images relating to troop and civilian activity in World War II.
